page.title: 05PEOPLE AND HOBBIES
page.content: A lady resident was born in the old School House (now part of Kingsland School) on 7.7.1897. Her father was the Headmaster at the school from 1894 until 1931. The family moved into the new school house (now called "Outer Bailey") in 1914. She taught at the school until she married a local farmer's son in 1926. She and her husband lived locally in the same house for 35 years until they moved to Lincoln House. Although now 88, she still takes an active part in the farm which her son now farms. She drove a car until mid-June, 1985. Activities of residents include gardening, fishing, shooting, beagling, cricket, football, rounders, tennis, golf, hockey, swimming, pigeon racing, BMX cycling, running, bridge, pop music, riding, hunting, horse racing, road rallying and ballet.
